import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; // node.js library that concatenates classes (strings) import classnames from "classnames"; // javascipt plugin for creating charts import Chart from "chart.js"; // react plugin used to create charts import { Line, Bar } from "react-chartjs-2"; // reactstrap components import { Button, Card, CardHeader, CardBody, NavItem, NavLink, Nav, Progress, Table, Container, Row, Col } from "reactstrap"; // core components import { chartOptions, parseOptions, chartExample1, chartExample2 } from "../variables/charts.js"; import moment from 'moment'; import Header from "../components/Headers/Header.js"; import { getReportsByGq } from "../query/index.js"; import { useQuery } from "react-query"; import DashboardHeader from "../components/Headers/DashboardHeader.js"; const Index = () => { const [activeNav, setactiveNav] = useState(1) const [chartExample1Data, setchartExample1Data] = useState("data1") const [reports, setreports] = useState([]) const repdata = useQuery(["reports", { date: moment().format("YYYY-MM-DD") }], getReportsByGq) useEffect(() => { if (window.Chart) { parseOptions(Chart, chartOptions()); } if (repdata.data) { setreports(repdata.data.reports.map((item) => { return item })) } }, [setreports, repdata.data]) const toggleNavs = (e, index) => { e.preventDefault(); setactiveNav(index) setchartExample1Data(data => data === "data1" ? "data2" : "data1") }; return ( <> {/* Page content */}
